bulbasaur: For some time after its birth, it uses the nutrients that are packed into the seed on its back in order to grow.
ivysaur: The more sunlight Ivysaur bathes in, the more strength wells up within it, allowing the bud on its back to grow larger.
venusaur: While it basks in the sun, it can convert the light into energy. As a result, it is more powerful in the summertime.
charmander: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life-force. If Charmander is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
charmeleon: When it swings its burning tail, the temperature around it rises higher and higher, tormenting its opponents.
charizard: If Charizard becomes truly angered, the flame at the tip of its tail burns in a light blue shade.
squirtle: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It sprays a potent foam from its mouth.
wartortle: Wartortle's long, furry tail is a symbol of longevity, so this Pokémon is quite popular among older people.
blastoise: It deliberately increases its body weight so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
ekans: It can freely detach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can become too heavy to move, however.
arbok: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.
pikachu: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
pikachu-1: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across lots of different regions together.
pikachu-hoenn: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the Hoenn region together.
pikachu-sinnoh: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the Sinnoh region together.
pikachu-unova: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the Unova region together.
pikachu-kalos: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the Kalos region together.
pikachu-alola: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the Alola region together.
pikachu-7: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon traveling together with its partner, whom it met in a fateful encounter.
pikachu-9: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokémon and its partner traveling across the world together.
raichu: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
sandshrew: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.
sandshrew-alola: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.
sandslash: It is adept at attacking with the spines on its back and its sharp claws while quickly scurrying about.
sandslash-alola: This Pokémon's steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.
clefairy: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.
clefable: Said to live in quiet, remote mountains, this type of fairy has a strong aversion to being seen.
vulpix: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
vulpix-alola: They live together in a skulk, helping one another. Before eating their prey, they freeze it solid with their -58 degree Fahrenheit breath.
ninetales: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystical power.
ninetales-alola: Possessing a calm demeanor, this Pokémon was revered as a deity incarnate before it was identified as a regional variant of Ninetales.
jigglypuff: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
wigglytuff: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
oddish: Its scientific name is Oddium wanderus. It is said to cover distances as far as 1,000 feet when night falls, walking on its two roots.
gloom: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
vileplume: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
venonat: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.
venomoth: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
diglett: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
diglett-alola: The things growing from its head are whiskers that have become metallic. Diglett communicates with its comrades by waving them.
dugtrio: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
dugtrio-alola: Its shining gold whiskers are advanced sensors that can detect vibrations from sounds several miles away.
meowth: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
persian: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
psyduck: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
golduck: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
mankey: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
primeape: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
growlithe: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
arcanine: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.
poliwag: The swirl on its belly is its insides showing through the skin. It appears more clearly after Poliwag eats.
poliwhirl: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.
poliwrath: Although it's skilled in a style of dynamic swimming that uses all its muscles, for some reason it lives on dry land.
bellsprout: No matter what Bellsprout is doing, if it detects movement nearby, it will immediately react by reaching out with its thin vines.
weepinbell: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
victreebel: It lures prey into its mouth with a nectar-like aroma. The helpless prey is melted with a dissolving fluid.
tentacool: When the tide goes out, dehydrated Tentacool can be found left behind on the shore.
tentacruel: On the rare occasions that large outbreaks of Tentacruel occur, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.
geodude: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
geodude-alola: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
graveler: A slow walker, it rolls to move. It pays no attention to any object that happens to be in its path.
graveler-alola: They eat rocks and often get into a scrap over them. The impact of Graveler smashing together causes a flash of light and a booming noise.
golem: It is enclosed in a hard shell that is as rugged as slabs of rock. It sheds skin once a year to grow larger.
golem-alola: It's grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.
slowpoke: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
slowpoke-galar: It gives off a stimulating scent because of chemicals that have seeped into its body from the spice that it eats as its staple food.
slowbro: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
slowbro-galar: Shellder seems blissful over the taste of Slowbro even though the toxins seeping from the bite have caused Shellder to faint.
magnemite: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
magneton: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
doduo: Its twin heads have exactly the same genes and battle in perfect sync with each other.
dodrio: It now has three hearts and three sets of lungs. Though it can't run as fast as Doduo, Dodrio can keep running for longer stretches of time.
seel: The protrusion on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
dewgong: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when it's colder.
grimer: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
grimer-alola: They store their toxins inside their bodies, so unlike Grimer from other regions, they don't smell bad even up close.
muk: It's thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
muk-alola: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.
shellder: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
cloyster: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
gastly: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
haunter: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
gengar: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
drowzee: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.
hypno: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
voltorb: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
electrode: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
exeggcute: If you touch one of Exeggcute's heads, mistaking it for an egg, the other heads will quickly gather and attack you in a swarm.
exeggutor: It is called the Walking Jungle. Each of the nuts has a face and a will of its own.
exeggutor-alola: It swings its long neck like a whip and smacks its head into opponents. This makes Exeggutor itself a little dizzy too.
hitmonlee: At the exact moment it lands a kick on its target, Hitmonlee hardens the muscles on the sole of its foot, maximizing the power of the kick.
hitmonchan: It corners its foes with combo punches from both sides, then finishes them off with a single straight punch launched at over 300 mph.
koffing: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.
weezing: Top-grade perfume is made using its internal poison gases by diluting them to the highest level.
rhyhorn: Rhyhorn claims an area with over a six mile radius as its territory. It apparently forgets where this territory is when running, however.
rhydon: The horn of a Rhydon is powerful enough to crush raw diamonds. These Pokémon polish their horns by bashing them together.
chansey: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.
horsea: If attacked—even by a large enemy—Horsea effortlessly swims to safety by utilizing its well-developed dorsal fin.
seadra: The male raises the young. If it is approached while caring for young, it will use its toxic spines to fend off the intruder.
scyther: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
electabuzz: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
magmar: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breather's body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
tauros: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
tauros-paldea-combat: This Pokémon has a muscular body and excels at close-quarters combat. It uses its short horns to strike the opponent's weak spots.
tauros-paldea-blaze: When heated by fire energy, its horns can get hotter than 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Those gored by them will suffer both wounds and burns.
tauros-paldea-aqua: This Pokémon blasts water from holes on the tips of its horns—the high-pressure jets pierce right through Tauros's enemies.
magikarp: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
gyarados: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
lapras: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
ditto: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.
eevee: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.
vaporeon: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.
jolteon: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
flareon: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
porygon: It is an artificial Pokémon. Since it doesn't breathe, people are excited by its potential to be useful in any environment.
snorlax: This gluttonous Pokémon eats constantly, apart from when it's asleep. It devours nearly 900 pounds of food per day.
dratini: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
dragonair: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
dragonite: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
chikorita: It loves to bask in the sunlight. It uses the leaf on its head to seek out warm places.
bayleef: The spicy scent that wafts from around Bayleef's neck somehow makes those who smell it want to fight.
meganium: Anyone who stands beside it becomes refreshed, just as if they were soaking in the soothing atmosphere of a forest.
cyndaquil: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
quilava: Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes.
typhlosion: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur to cause huge explosions.
totodile: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its Trainer must be careful.
croconaw: The tips of its fangs are slanted backward. Once those fangs clamp down, the prey has no hope of escape.
feraligatr: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
sentret: This Pokémon is extremely cautious. Its supple tail is well muscled and firm to the touch.
furret: It raises its offspring inside a long, narrow nest. Once they're old enough, it takes them outside the nest to prepare them for independence.
hoothoot: Hoothoot's internal clock is precise at all times. It tilts its head in a fixed rhythm.
noctowl: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
spinarak: Even while there are prey ensnared in its nest of spun thread, Spinarak will wait motionlessly until darkness falls.
ariados: A single strand of a special thread is endlessly spun out of its rear. The thread leads back to its nest.
chinchou: It lives in ocean depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
lanturn: Portions of its dorsal fin mutated, becoming the parts that glow brightly to lure prey.
pichu: It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.
cleffa: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
igglybuff: Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.
mareep: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
flaaffy: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.
ampharos: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.
bellossom: Due to the effects of the Sun Stone, it is now active during the daytime. It likes to dance in pools of sunlight.
marill: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.
azumarill: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.
sudowoodo: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
politoed: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
hoppip: This Pokémon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.
skiploom: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokémon's head.
jumpluff: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.
aipom: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
sunkern: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. Knowing it's weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.
sunflora: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
yanma: As Yanma surveys its territory, it periodically stops to hover in place by flapping its wings at high speeds.
wooper: A transparent mucous membrane covers its body. Touching it bare-handed will cause a tingling numbness.
wooper-paldea: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokémon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
quagsire: This carefree Pokémon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.
espeon: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponent's next move.
umbreon: When exposed to the moon's aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.
murkrow: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
slowking: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpoke's head and unlocked an extraordinary power.
slowking-galar: It administers its potions to weakened Pokémon it sees. These potions are derived from poison and secreted from holes in Slowking's horns.
misdreavus: This Pokémon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
girafarig: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
pineco: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.
forretress: It's usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.
dunsparce: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.
gligar: It builds its nest on a steep cliff. When it is done gliding, it hops along the ground back to its nest.
snubbull: In truth, it is a cowardly Pokémon. It growls eagerly in order to hide its fear from its opponent.
granbull: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it desperately flails its limbs about in an attempt to repel its opponent.
qwilfish: Be cautious if this Pokémon starts sucking in water—it will soon attack by scattering the toxic spikes that grow all over its body.
qwilfish-hisui: It lives just offshore in cold parts of the world. Its poisonous spikes are thicker and shorter than those of other regions' Qwilfish.
scizor: This Pokémon's pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.
heracross: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
sneasel: This cunning Pokémon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.
teddiursa: This Pokémon discreetly follows Combee to find their hive. It scoops up big dollops of honey in its palms to eat.
ursaring: It usually wears a hardened expression, but when it's licking up honey—which it loves—the joy it feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.
slugma: Its lava body can cool and chip away at times, but a magma bath will heal it right up.
magcargo: This Pokémon lives near the craters of volcanoes. It stores fire energy in its shell of cooled and hardened magma.
swinub: It searches for food by digging into the ground with its snout. Even frozen ground doesn't give it any trouble.
piloswine: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is resistant to the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.
delibird: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
skarmory: Its sturdy, heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.
houndour: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.
houndoom: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.
kingdra: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.
phanpy: This Pokémon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it won't be able to settle down unless it washes its body.
donphan: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car won't faze this Pokémon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.
porygon2: This artificial Pokémon evolved thanks to cutting- edge science. It sometimes displays behavior that is not in its programming.
stantler: This Pokémon apparently used to live in much harsher environments, and thus it once had stronger psychic powers than it does now.
smeargle: Once a Smeargle reaches adulthood, it will have other members of its species leave paw prints on its back.
tyrogue: This earnest Pokémon battles all sorts of opponents, searching for the fighting style that suits it best.
hitmontop: This Pokémon is adept at dance-like kicks. The horn atop its head is made from the same substance that generally forms fur and claws.
elekid: It loves violent thunder. The space between its horns flickers bluish white when it is charging energy.
magby: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, sparks leak from its mouth and nostrils.
blissey: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
larvitar: Born deep underground, this Pokémon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
pupitar: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.
tyranitar: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesn't care about others.
treecko: The small hooks on the soles of its feet latch on to walls and ceilings, so it will never fall even while hanging upside down.
grovyle: Its strongly developed thigh muscles give it astounding agility and jumping performance.
sceptile: It agilely flits through the jungle and uses the sharp-edged leaves on its arms to cut down its prey.
torchic: Torchic feels toasty warm if you hug it. It has a flame sac inside its belly, and the flames burn continuously as long as Torchic has life in it.
combusken: It boosts its concentration by emitting harsh cries. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
blaziken: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.
mudkip: It has the power to crush large boulders into pieces. To rest, it buries itself in mud at the bottom of a river.
marshtomp: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has served to train its lower body and caused it to develop sturdy legs.
swampert: Its arms are hard as rock. With one swing, it can break an enormous boulder into pieces.
poochyena: It bares its large fangs and barks vigorously to try to intimidate opponents, but this is actually a manifestation of its cowardly nature.
mightyena: They faithfully follow the orders of their leader. Prey targeted by Mightyena is never allowed to escape the outstanding teamwork of its pursuers.
lotad: The leaf on its head is naturally dirt repellent and will stay clean even after transporting Pokémon that are covered in mud.
lombre: Old folklore in Kitakami tells of a mischievous child who was reborn as a Pokémon.
ludicolo: There are structures throughout its whole body that produce energy when hit by sound waves with a cheerful rhythm.
seedot: To expand its habitat, it pretends to be a nut so that bird Pokémon will pick it up and carry it far away.
nuzleaf: It leads a quiet life deep in the forest. If anything wanders into its territory, Nuzleaf will warn the intruder by sounding its grass flute.
shiftry: It is said that when Shiftry flaps its leafy fans atop ancient trees, chilly winds blow and the season rolls into winter.
wingull: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
pelipper: It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokémon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.
ralts: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense people's emotions.
kirlia: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
gardevoir: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.
surskit: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
masquerain: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction—to and fro and sideways.
shroomish: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.
breloom: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.
slakoth: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.
vigoroth: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
slaking: It is the world's most slothful Pokémon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
makuhita: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokémon that can withstand any attack.
hariyama: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.
azurill: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
nosepass: The magnet in Nosepass's nose provides an unerring compass, making this Pokémon an excellent partner for Trainers going on a journey.
sableye: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.
meditite: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.
medicham: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's next move.
plusle: It cheers on partners while scattering sparks from its body. It climbs telephone poles to absorb electricity.
minun: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
volbeat: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.
illumise: Illumise uses its sweet scent to guide Volbeat, having them form over 200 patterns in the night sky.
gulpin: There is nothing its stomach can't digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
swalot: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
numel: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.
camerupt: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.
torkoal: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
spoink: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.
grumpig: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
trapinch: This Pokémon lives in arid deserts. It patiently awaits prey inside its funnel- shaped nest.
vibrava: Rather than using its underdeveloped wings for flight, it rubs them together, emitting ultrasonic waves to attack its enemies.
flygon: Known as the Desert Spirit, this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
cacnea: It prefers harsh environments, such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.
cacturne: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.
swablu: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
altaria: If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.
zangoose: It's Seviper's archrival. To threaten those it encounters, it fans out the claws on its front paws.
seviper: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
barboach: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.
whiscash: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.
corphish: It came from overseas. It is a very hardy creature that will quickly proliferate, even in polluted streams.
crawdaunt: Loving to battle, this Pokémon pinches all Pokémon that enter its territory with its pincers and throws them out.
feebas: This tough Pokémon is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isn't popular.
milotic: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow- colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.
shuppet: It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.
banette: This Pokémon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.
duskull: In the dead of night, these Pokémon wander through towns in search of children, whose vital energy is a Duskull's favorite food.
dusclops: Dusclops is feared because it's said to pull the soul out of anyone who gazes upon the strange movements of its hands.
tropius: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.
chimecho: It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree or from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.
snorunt: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.
glalie: Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the cold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While they're in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.
luvdisc: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.
bagon: Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders. It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it can fly.
shelgon: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
salamence: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up everything it passes over.
beldum: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground's natural magnetism, letting it float.
metang: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.
metagross: It folds its four legs when flying. Its four brains are said to be superior to a supercomputer.
turtwig: The shell on its back is made of soil. If the shell is moist to the touch, Turtwig is very healthy.
grotle: Grotle live in the forest. Each is said to have its own secret place for getting clean springwater.
torterra: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground dwelt a gigantic Torterra.
chimchar: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
monferno: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
infernape: This Pokémon confounds opponents with its speed. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
piplup: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
prinplup: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees in half with a single hit.
empoleon: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them in two with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
starly: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
staravia: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
staraptor: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
kricketot: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
kricketune: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
shinx: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
luxio: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
luxray: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
cranidos: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
rampardos: Stifled by a thick skull that can withstand any impact, this Pokémon's brain never got very big.
shieldon: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it has no particular need to battle with others and can spend its time feeding on grass and berries.
bastiodon: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.
combee: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.
vespiquen: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
pachirisu: It's one of the kinds of Pokémon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
buizel: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
floatzel: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
shellos: It used to have a shell on its back long ago. This species is closely related to Pokémon like Shellder.
shellos-1: A recently published research paper states that this form of Shellos is gradually decreasing in number.
gastrodon: Its whole body is sticky with mucus. In the past, this form of Gastrodon was by far the more numerous one.
gastrodon-1: They normally inhabit rocky seashores, but in times of continuous rain, they can sometimes be found in the mountains, far from the sea.
ambipom: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
drifloon: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.
drifblim: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.
mismagius: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
honchkrow: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.
chingling: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
stunky: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokémon away.
skuntank: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
bronzor: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzor's back contained a mysterious power.
bronzong: In ages past, this Pokémon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
bonsly: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.
happiny: It carries a round, white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
spiritomb: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
gible: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
gabite: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
garchomp: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
munchlax: It needs to consume its own weight in food every day. As far as flavor is concerned, it's indifferent.
riolu: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
lucario: It's said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auras—even those of foes it could not otherwise see.
hippopotas: It shuts its nostrils tight, then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
hippowdon: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
croagunk: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
toxicroak: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
finneon: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
lumineon: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokémon—its natural predators.
snover: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountain's lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
abomasnow: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
weavile: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
magnezone: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
rhyperior: This Pokémon's sturdy carapace protects it from volcanic eruptions. It shoots round rocks from the holes in its hands.
electivire: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
magmortar: When shooting 3,600 degree Fahrenheit fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
yanmega: Yanmega's wingbeats are so powerful that the Pokémon blows down huge trees nearby when it vigorously launches itself into flight.
leafeon: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
glaceon: It can control its body temperature at will. This enables it to freeze the moisture in the atmosphere, creating flurries of diamond dust.
gliscor: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
mamoswine: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokémon has been around a long, long, long time.
porygon-z: An additional program was installed to create a more advanced Pokémon, but it was apparently flawed. Porygon-Z moves oddly as a result.
gallade: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
probopass: It controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force. With them, it can attack a foe from three directions.
dusknoir: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and take them to the afterlife.
froslass: When it finds humans or Pokémon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
rotom: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
rotom-1: If the convection microwave oven is not working properly, then the Rotom inhabiting it will become lethargic.
rotom-2: This Rotom has entered a washing machine. It nods with satisfaction after it floods the surrounding area.
rotom-3: This Rotom has entered a refrigerator. It leaps around gleefully after it uses cold air to freeze the area around it.
rotom-4: This Rotom has entered an electric fan. It smirks with satisfaction over a prank well pulled after it blows away everything around it.
rotom-5: The lawn mower is one of the household appliances that led to the development of the Rotom Dex.
snivy: The leaf on Snivy's tail generates energy when exposed to sunlight, making Snivy swifter and adding an edge to its moves.
servine: It runs low to the ground, weaving through the grass, then mercilessly pummels its target by whipping them with its vines.
serperior: It generates energy from sunlight, then amplifies that energy dozens of times within its long body.
tepig: It's more nimble than it looks, and it uses its speed to confound its enemies. It rapidly launches fireballs from both nostrils.
pignite: When Pignite enters battle, its body temperature rapidly soars until Pignite itself is engulfed by a scorching fireball.
emboar: The flames blazing deep inside Emboar's chest erupt vigorously from its chin, forming a beard of fire.
oshawott: It wields the scalchop on its stomach like a knife, blocking the moves of its enemies before slashing back at them in swift retaliation.
dewott: It's said that people modeled swordplay after the way Dewott's movements flow like water while it's wielding its two scalchops.
samurott: A master of a sword-drawing art called iaijutsu, Samurott settles its battles with a single swing of either large sword sheathed in its foreleg armor.
blitzle: Its heartbeat generates electricity. When Blitzle is surprised and its heart rate goes up, the voltage of its electricity also rises.
zebstrika: This Pokémon is aggressive and has a volatile disposition. When agitated, it will illuminate its mane in yellow and fire off bolts of electricity.
drilbur: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
excadrill: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
timburr: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
gurdurr: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.
conkeldurr: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
sewaddle: Sewaddle chews on leaves to make its clothing. It's trying to mimic the leafy garment Leavanny first dressed it in.
swadloon: Swadloon lives quietly at the feet of trees. It prefers eating fallen leaves that have grown soft rather than fresh ones.
leavanny: This gentle Pokémon has strong protective instincts. The leaves on its arms are sharp enough to slice a thick tree in half with one stroke.
cottonee: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.
whimsicott: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
petilil: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
lilligant: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
basculin: Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokémon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.
basculin-1: These Pokémon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
basculin-2: They live in frigid seas, forming schools and sharing food among themselves. When the time comes, they return to the river they were born in.
sandile: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
krokorok: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
krookodile: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
scraggy: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. Among Scraggy, individuals with saggier skin apparently garner more respect.
scrafty: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
zorua: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
zoroark: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
minccino: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean springwater.
cinccino: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
gothita: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
gothorita: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
gothitelle: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe's end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.
solosis: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.
duosion: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
reuniclus: Their arms are made of a special liquid. They use psychic power to control these arms and crush boulders.
ducklett: It's not very good at flying yet. It watches the dances of its Swanna parents to learn how to move its wings.
swanna: Centered around its leader, the flock dances in perfect sync to strengthen its unity.
deerling: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In early spring, these Pokémon give off a delicate, sweet, and calming scent.
deerling-1: To prevent Deerling from entering their fields, many farmers will have several Lycanroc stand guard, as they are the natural enemy of Deerling.
deerling-2: These Pokémon are not shy—they will behave as they please, even in front of people. If you feed one of them, it will quickly take a liking to you.
deerling-3: Deerling's scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokémon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.
sawsbuck: It seems that a Sawsbuck with many flowers on its antlers will grow at a slightly slower pace because the flowers absorb the Pokémon's nutrients.
sawsbuck-1: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
sawsbuck-2: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
sawsbuck-3: It's said that Sawsbuck are calm and easy to tame during the season when they take on this form, so it's the perfect time to make one your partner.
foongus: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
amoonguss: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss's caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
alomomola: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
joltik: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
galvantula: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
tynamo: While one alone doesn't have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
eelektrik: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
eelektross: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
litwick: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when Litwick absorbs life-force from people or Pokémon.
lampent: Lampent appears at the moment of death and promptly absorbs the spirit as it leaves the body.
chandelure: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
axew: This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
fraxure: Because its tusks don't grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won't use them unless truly necessary.
haxorus: This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
cubchoo: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there's a chance it is sick.
beartic: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.
cryogonal: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.
mienfoo: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
mienshao: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you're in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!
golett: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.
golurk: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately. During such rampages, it can turn a whole town into a mountain of rubble.
pawniard: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.
bisharp: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
rufflet: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
braviary: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
vullaby: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokémon.
mandibuzz: It's always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.
deino: It can't see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
zweilous: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don't give each head the same amount of attention, they'll begin fighting out of jealousy.
hydreigon: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
larvesta: This Pokémon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.
volcarona: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.
chespin: When Chespin tenses up just before landing a headbutt, the spikes on its head sharpen to points, piercing the enemy's body on contact.
quilladin: It's protected by a sturdy shell. The shell is also very heavy, which naturally strengthens Quilladin's lower body.
chesnaught: When its allies are in trouble, Chesnaught creates a shield with its arms and uses its own body to block attacks.
fennekin: This Pokémon gets worked up easily. Its body can also overheat, so it uses its ears to dissipate the heat and calm down.
braixen: It ignites the twig from its tail and waves the twig around to signal its allies. To indicate danger, it draws circles in the air with the twig's flame.
delphox: It leaves burn marks in the ground with the flame at the tip of its wand. Long ago, people used the shapes of these burn marks for divination.
froakie: Its happy-go-lucky look is an act intended to fool its enemies. It will suddenly drop the facade and overwhelm its foes with its blinding speed.
frogadier: It excels at devising battle strategies that make use of the terrain, and it never misses its mark when throwing bubble-covered pebbles.
greninja: The movement of air against the long tongue Greninja keeps wrapped around its neck allows it to sense enemies it can't see.
fletchling: This Pokémon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
fletchinder: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokémon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
talonflame: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
scatterbug: Any poison this Pokémon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. That's why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.
spewpa: If Rufflet attacks this Pokémon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.
vivillon: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from frigid lands.
vivillon-1: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from snowy lands.
vivillon-2: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of severe cold.
vivillon-3: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of vast space.
vivillon-4: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from verdant lands.
vivillon-5: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with distinct seasons.
vivillon-6: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where flowers bloom.
vivillon-7: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from sun-drenched lands.
vivillon-8: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with ocean breezes.
vivillon-9: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from places with many islands.
vivillon-10: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with little rain.
vivillon-11: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from parched lands.
vivillon-12: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands where large rivers flow.
vivillon-13: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with intense rainfall.
vivillon-14: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands with a tropical climate.
vivillon-15: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands bathed in light.
vivillon-16: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of perpetual summer.
vivillon-17: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from lands of tropical rain forests.
vivillon-18: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a mysterious land.
vivillon-19: The patterns on this Pokémon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from a special land.
litleo: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
pyroar: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. It's thanks to them that their pride doesn't starve.
flabebe: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.
flabebe-1: This Flabébé rides a yellow flower. The Pokémon is defenseless and vulnerable before it has found and received power from a flower.
flabebe-2: This Flabébé rides an orange flower. On its head, it wears a crown of pollen that has healing properties.
flabebe-3: Once it finds a flower it likes, this Pokémon will spend the rest of its life taking care of its flower. This Flabébé rides a blue flower.
flabebe-4: This Flabébé rides a white flower. The wind blows this Pokémon around as it drifts in search of flower gardens.
floette: This Pokémon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.
floette-1: This Pokémon can draw forth the power hidden within yellow flowers. This power then becomes the moves Floette uses to protect itself.
floette-2: This Pokémon can draw forth the most power when in sync with orange flowers, compared to flowers of other colors.
floette-3: Whenever this Pokémon finds flowering plants that are withering, it will bring them back to its territory and care for them until they are healthy.
floette-4: Floette that are fond of white flowers can also easily sync with flowers of other colors.
florges: This Pokémon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.
florges-1: It is said that there was once a Florges that protected the garden of a castle for over 300 years.
florges-2: Its orange flowers fire off powerful beams, attacking as if they were a battery of artillery.
florges-3: Though usually compassionate, Florges will hunt down anyone who vandalizes its flower garden, showing no mercy even if they beg for their lives.
florges-4: A flower garden made by a white-flowered Florges will be beautifully decorated with flowering plants of many different colors.
skiddo: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokémon to traverse the mountain paths.
gogoat: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.
espurr: It keeps its ears covered to prevent the intense psychic power in its body from escaping, but it falls unconscious if this power builds too much.
meowstic: Though it has enough psychic power to blast away any opponent, Meowstic prefers to support its allies rather than attack.
meowstic-1: Female Meowstic are more aggressive than males. Their expression remains blank even while they're wielding immense psychic power.
inkay: It protects itself from tough foes by flashing its luminescent spots to discourage them.
malamar: Its hypnotic powers are dangerously strong. Anyone who falls under Malamar's control loses their memories surrounding the event.
skrelp: Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.
dragalge: Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.
clauncher: This Pokémon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokémon.
clawitzer: Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.
sylveon: This Pokémon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.
hawlucha: Its elegant finishing moves—performed by nimbly leaping around using its wings—are polished in the forest where it was born and raised.
dedenne: It's small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from people's homes and charge itself.
carbink: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
goomy: Most of a Goomy's body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokémon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.
sliggoo: The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.
goodra: It loves the rain. This mellow Pokémon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.
klefki: Once it absorbs a key's metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
phantump: Legend tells that its green leaves can cure any illness. When plucked, however, the leaves will instantly wither away.
trevenant: Using its roots, Trevenant connects itself to trees and monitors every corner of its forest. It uses curses to drive intruders away.
bergmite: They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.
avalugg: As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.
noibat: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.
noivern: Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokémon has a cruel disposition.
rowlet: Silently it glides, streaking toward its targets to get close to them. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
dartrix: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don't groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.
decidueye: It cunningly conceals arrow quills in its wings. It launches these quills with such precision that they can pierce a pebble at over a hundred yards.
litten: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
torracat: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever fire spews out.
incineroar: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
popplio: This Pokémon can control balloons made of water. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big balloons.
brionne: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, then briskly bombards its enemies.
primarina: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
pikipek: Using its beak to strike 16 times per second, it opens holes in even the hardest of trees.
trumbeak: It flies around using a hundred different cries in various ways to declare its territory to others.
toucannon: The compressed gas in Toucannon's beak launches seeds with such force that they can shatter large boulders.
yungoos: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
gumshoos: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
grubbin: Grubbin normally live underground, but if they get unearthed by Hoothoot, they may be found gathered around electric Pokémon.
charjabug: Protected by a sturdy shell, Charjabug eats large quantities of fresh and decomposing leaf litter in order to evolve.
vikavolt: Displaying exceptional mobility, it weaves between trees and shoots down bird Pokémon with its electromagnetic beams.
crabrawler: This Pokémon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
crabominable: The detached pincers of these Pokémon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.
oricorio: This Pokémon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
oricorio-1: This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar. It uses nimble steps to approach opponents, then knocks them out with electric punches.
oricorio-2: The airy dance of these Oricorio is popular as a means of maintaining good health, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
oricorio-3: This form of Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. It uses ethereal dance steps to call forth the spirits of the dead.
cutiefly: When it senses the auras of people or Pokémon who are having fun, it will draw close and give them a painful poke with its long proboscis.
ribombee: Ribombee can sense when people or Pokémon are feeling down, and it will cheer them up with handmade pollen puffs.
rockruff: This Pokémon is very friendly when it's young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
lycanroc: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.
lycanroc-1: This Pokémon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.
lycanroc-2: Normally this Pokémon doesn't even bark, but once it enters battle, it will relentlessly drive the opponent into a corner.
mareanie: This Pokémon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
toxapex: This Pokémon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.
mudbray: This Pokémon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud won't dry out even if it's exposed to the sun for a long time.
mudsdale: This Pokémon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
dewpider: Dewpider uses sticky threads to create the water bubble that covers its head, so the bubble very rarely bursts.
araquanid: A caring Pokémon, Araquanid carries Dewpider around inside its water bubble to protect them as it walks. It protects its food in its bubble too.
fomantis: Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
lurantis: By masquerading as a bug Pokémon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokémon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
salandit: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
salazzle: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.
bounsweet: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
steenee: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.
tsareena: This Pokémon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.
comfey: It uses its vine to pick flowers. The flowers that Comfey attaches to itself develop healing properties.
oranguru: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokémon of the forest.
passimian: This Pokémon battles by throwing hard berries. It won't obey a Trainer who throws Poké Balls without skill.
sandygast: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else— like a branch—in its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
palossand: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokémon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
minior: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-1: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-2: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-3: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-4: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-5: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-6: This Pokémon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
minior-7: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
minior-8: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
minior-9: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
minior-10: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
minior-11: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
minior-12: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
minior-13: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come true—all they can do is fade away.
komala: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.
mimikyu: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
mimikyu-1: Even as it struggles beneath the cloth to repair the broken neck of its disguise, Mimikyu keeps up its impersonation of Pikachu.
bruxish: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
jangmo-o: The scale atop its head is useful for both offense and defense. It bravely stands and faces its foes rather than turning tail, even if its foes are strong.
hakamo-o: It gets into fistfights so intense that the scales on its arms peel off. Bare arms are a sign of valiance.
kommo-o: It lets its arm hang, and then—quick as a flash— swings upward to land its specialty punch and send the opponent flying high into the sky.
grookey: The stick Grookey holds has grown harder and more flexible after soaking in the energy that emanates from inside Grookey's body.
thwackey: It skillfully uses its two sticks not only for drumming out rapid beats but also for pummeling opponents during battle.
rillaboom: Though it has a calm disposition, it won't tolerate those who drum up discord. It strictly disciplines offenders until they learn their lesson.
scorbunny: Once its body has heated up, Scorbunny can use the full extent of its power. That's why it does warm-up exercises.
raboot: Thanks to its soft and fluffy fur, Raboot can easily heat up its fire energy and produce flames with more power.
cinderace: Although Cinderace loses its cool easily, it will battle flawlessly for a Trainer it trusts.
sobble: It gets berries to eat by shooting them down with bullets of water it spurts from its mouth. Its aim is perfect.
drizzile: It extends its long, slimy tongue at blinding speeds and finishes off its prey with great skill.
inteleon: It uses special lenses in its eyes to sense things about its opponents—like their body heat—then attacks once it identifies a weak spot.
skwovet: It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.
greedent: If it spots a berry tree, it will immediately go to gather berries without a sideways glance—even if it's in the middle of a battle.
rookidee: This Pokémon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidee's eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokémon.
corvisquire: It's said that the reason behind Corvisquire's high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokémon.
corviknight: Corviknight can't serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokémon's natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.
chewtle: Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokémon will bite another Chewtle's horn, and the two Pokémon will tussle.
drednaw: Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokémon has an extremely vicious disposition.
rolycoly: On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.
carkol: The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.
coalossal: To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.
applin: It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apple's skin and prevent it from rotting.
flapple: It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponent's guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.
appletun: It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokémon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.
silicobra: Silicobra's neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.
sandaconda: It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.
cramorant: Cramorant instinctively swallow everything whole. They're at their most formidable when they're struggling to swallow overly large prey.
cramorant-1: Cramorant is constantly on the hunt for food along riverbanks. It loves Arrokuda—when it finds them, it swallows them whole without a thought.
cramorant-2: Its throat is clearly not wide enough to swallow a Pikachu, and yet Cramorant makes no move to release its catch.
arrokuda: Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.
barraskewda: It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the water's surface.
toxel: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxel's body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.
toxtricity: As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.
toxtricity-1: Many youths admire the way this Pokémon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.
sinistea: The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokémon appears in hotels and houses.
sinistea-1: Some fanatics will go to great pains to prepare the perfect tea and teacup, eagerly waiting for a Sinistea to come and possess their selections.
polteageist: The tea that composes Polteageist's body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.
polteageist-1: Apparently a Polteageist's disposition is affected by the type of tea the Pokémon came from. What teapot it inhabits makes no difference.
hatenna: Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokémon prefers environments where no other creatures live.
hattrem: To this Pokémon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noises—even if the emotions are happy ones.
hatterene: Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.
impidimp: The reason this Pokémon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it can't absorb negative emotions.
morgrem: Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesn't have confidence in its brawn.
grimmsnarl: This Pokémon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.
milcery: The more sweet aromas it absorbs, the more its body swells. Milcery will deflate when its energy level drops.
alcremie: Desserts that Alcremie have decorated with their cream have a rich, sweet flavor and bring happiness to all who eat them.
alcremie-1: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a sweet and tart flavor.
alcremie-2: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it an aromatic flavor.
alcremie-3: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a refreshing flavor.
alcremie-4: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a sour flavor.
alcremie-5: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a salty flavor.
alcremie-6: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a mixed flavor.
alcremie-7: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a bitter flavor.
alcremie-8: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a complex flavor.
falinks: The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.
pincurchin: This Pokémon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
snom: It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.
frosmoth: Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.
stonjourner: The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokémon's habitat.
eiscue: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
eiscue-1: The ice that was covering this Eiscue's face has shattered. Eiscue emits cold air from the tip of its hair to protect its head, which is sensitive to heat.
indeedee: This Pokémon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.
indeedee-1: It dislikes conflict. If a fight occurs in its territory, it uses psychic power to throw things at the combatants in an effort to drive them away.
